programme.title: Amanda Bynes THS
programme.desc: She was Nickelodeon’s It Girl, the irrepressible, wide-eyed child star who began acting at the age of 7, had starred in four popular children’s shows by age 14 and parlayed her acting talents into hit movies including She’s the Man, Easy A, and What a Girl Wants. But in March 2012, the same Bynes who had long been known to shun the Hollywood party scene started to publicly unravel, as she made headlines for her unusual and erratic behavior. In this hour we’ll explore why her latest woes have earned her comparisons to troubled starlet Lindsay Lohan, and why the public wonders whether she can get the help she needs – before it’s too late.

Tales From The Bush Larder
programme.desc: Tales From The Bush Larder takes you on a culinary tour of Kenya. Shot against breathtaking landscapes, each episode explores the source of one of the unusual ingredients that the country is rich in: Nile perch from Lake Turkana, African wild honey and wild fowl, Swahili prawns, Boran beef, Dorobo lamb, Palm Wine, Mud Crabs from the Northern Coast. The series is hosted by Kiran Jethwa, a Kenyan born and internationally renowned chef.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The fearless fishermen of Massachusetts battle the elements and each other to catch one of the biggest, smartest and fastest fish in the world - the giant bluefin tuna. These hard-core fishermen use only a rod and reel to capture a beast that can swim at over 40 mph and weigh up to 900 kg. A single fish can deliver a $20,000 pay-day, so the competition is fierce. The pressure is compounded as a cocky, young team invades local waters with the goal of out-fishing the veteran local boats.

programme.title: Alaska's Fishing Wars
programme.desc: Jump on-board for an adrenalin-packed adventure exposing the harsh working environments endured by Alaska’s fishermen in Alaska's Fishing Wars. Get an eye-opening insight into life on a fishing boat, the job of workers in the processing facilities and the pilots on hand to help comrades and scout in seaplanes. Then of course there’s the authorities; the Departments of Fish and Game representatives who must oversee everything.Capturing the process from the harvest to the marketplace, examine how the purse seine net fishery and the long line fishery operate all year round – purse seine fishing involves large ships with massive nets that literally scoop the fish out of the water, picking up to 15,000lbs of fish at a time.Long line fishermen send out miles and miles of line with thousands of hooks, looking to catch fish such as halibut, whilst battling the brutal Alaskan elements.And witness the brutal and highly competitive annual Sock-Eye Salmon Fishing where rival boats literally smash into each other to serve the best catch.

programme.title: Fish Warrior
programme.desc: Meet Fish Warrior Jakub Vágner: a man to whom fishing isn't just a hobby - it's a way of life. The conservationist and explorer has dedicated his life to hunting down the world's most monstrous fish, smashing five world records along the way. Now, he's doing it all on camera, to give you the opportunity to see this all-conquering angler do what he does best. First up, he's takes down a Colossal Catfish and then he tracks down a Nile Perch. Afterwards he heads off in search of an Amazon Giant. His journey continues with a Freshwater Stingray before an Alligator Gar gets the Jakub treatment.

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings
programme.desc: ‘Building fish mansions not fish bowls’ is their mantra and this sensational series shows why. Follow the best in the aquarium industry as they battle against piscatorial peril to create the most extreme fish tanks and fill them with exotic species from around the world.Taking on the most mammoth of missions, no job is too big for the Fish Tank Kings.

programme.title: Charley Boorman: By Any Means
programme.desc: Adventurer Charley Boorman undertakes an epic trip from Wicklow in Ireland to Sydney, Australia and will travel by any means of transport appropriate to the particular region he is traveling through. The series features Charley progressing around the globe, meeting some fascinating people, and traveling by some intriguing modes of transport.Charley will travel overland and across bodies of water through 25 amazing and fascinating countries and by some incredible forms of transport. This kind of overland journey is one that takes us back to the days before commercial airlines made travel so easy and accessible. Charley will be visiting UNICEF projects along the route to see the wonderful work that is being achieved by the charity across the world.Want to see more exclusive behind the scenes footage of Charley Boorman and his adventures? Check out the Big Earth channel on Nat Geo Adventure now.

programme.title: Cesar Millan: The Real Story
programme.desc: This is Cesar Millan’s incredible life journey.From his rise from impoverished illegal immigrant to international superstar celebrity dog trainer, this is a classic rags-to-riches real-life story.In Cesar Millan: The Real Story, learn the complete, poignant story as Cesar candidly discusses everything from his nerve-racking trek across the Mexican border to his personal struggles and truly dark moments, and how he developed his extraordinary skill at training man’s best friend. This is the real tale of The Dog Whisperer’s life.

programme.title: Leopard Queen
programme.desc: Powerful. Deadly. Elusive. Manana is a wild leopard. She could kill a man with ease. Yet besides her sits JV, unarmed and unharmed no bars, no cage. She gently brushes past him, almost touching. Today she will allow him to join her as a hunter, a privilege rarely bestowed on fellow leopards, let alone a human. John Varty, wildlife cameraman, has a unique friendship with this wild cat and has gained access to the mysterious world of one of nature's most enigmatic animals.With each day bringing a new battle for survival, experience Manana's life of terror and triumph in Leopard Queen.

programme.title: Mighty Meerkats
programme.desc: They're the furry creatures that have taken the world by storm. Now you can meet the animals behind the adverts in Mighty Meerkats on Nat Geo Wild.These furry fellas are brave, unruly and endearing characters that provide more real-life drama than any ad agency could dream up.Filmed in remarkable close-up, this is what life is really like in the Kalahari Desert when you're just 12 inches tall.From births to deaths, babysitters to battles, eagle attacks to infanticide, get the inside scoop, both cute and cruel, on how meerkat society really works.

programme.title: My Gorilla Family
programme.desc: They're one of our closest relatives but, without the work of scientists like British biologist Angelique Todd, you would know very little about Western Lowland Gorillas such a Makumba, a majestic silverback.In My Gorilla Family, Angelique offers you an unprecedented view of this gorilla family's world.Having lived in the Congo rainforest for over a decade, Angelique has suffered malaria and snakebites and she previously lost part of her finger in a chimpanzee attack.But, despite the hardships, her persistence has been worth it and has seen her earn Makumba's trust, allowing her to get close to this 200-kilogramme great ape, his harem of three females and his eight offspring.But there could be trouble brewing for these mighty primates - at the grand gorilla age of 32, mighty Makumba is growing old.Can this weary warrior see off challengers to his reign, and keep the rivalries within his harem in check?

programme.title: The Last Lions
programme.desc: Life as a lion isn't always easy, as shown by this gripping tale of a mother trying to protect her cubs. The Last Lions is a stunning film featuring award winning filmmakers Dereck and Beverly Joubert. With enemies everywhere waiting to attack this feline family, celebrated wildlife filmmakers, Dereck and Beverly, bring you an insight into the life-or-death battles a big cat mum faces every day. See their fight for survival as they overcome all manner of hazard; from the raging wildfires on the Delta, to the jealousy of sister lionesses, to the marauding males who kill her mate, to the prey that becomes predator. This is an incredible true story of survival that will move you as no other wildlife film has done.Cause an Uproar and help Save Big Cats!Click here to donate to National Geographic's Big Cats Initiative and raise money for field research.

programme.title: Pandas: Back To The Wild
programme.desc: Follow the life of giant pandas and their life over the course of one year.Go on an amazing journey from the panda breeding centre in Bifengzia to the Wolong nature reserves as this one-off special provides you with unparalleled insights into the world of the panda, the drive to increase this magnificent creature’s population and the efforts to return captive pandas back into the wild.Pandas: Back To The Wild airs on Nat Geo WILD and Sky 3D on Sunday 22 September at 8PM.

programme.title: Swamp Men
programme.desc: Deep in Florida's Everglades lies a unique attraction: an animal park run by the Seminole tribe. Returning to the wetlands for a second series, Swamp Men 2 follows the staff as they attempt to immerse the public in some of America's wildest land. Can they teach the respect for animals that's been a part of their culture for generations? The new series airs Fridays at 8pm from 4 March.Swamp Men: Bee BombThe team at the Billie Swamp Safari embarks on a mammoth spring cleaning of the park in preparation for Memorial Day, one of the busiest weekends of the year. But will a colony of thousands of bees ruin the holiday?Swamp Men: Croc SwapSafari director Ed Woods has a difficult - and dangerous - job on his hands as he looks to relocate a number of huge and potentially deadly Nile crocodiles to a new home.Swamp Men: Gator Breakout There's more croc commotion when Ed and his team realise that an alligator has escaped from 'Alcatraz', the fenced-in area that houses the nuisance gators that might have been destroyed elsewhere in Florida.Swamp Men: Fire Hazard The guys risk life and limb to search for injured animals while a forest fire ravages the nearby Seminole cultural area. With the hard work done, Ed organises a frog-leg eating contest to celebrate. But who will leap to victory?

programme.title: Crocodile Ganglands
programme.desc: In Zambia's remote Luangwa Valley there is one Nile crocodile so huge he reigns supreme as the undisputed king. Here, crocodiles thrive, and this ferocious, six-metre-long beast has his pick of the territory, the females and the food. However, this animal equivalent of the gangland boss is in for a rough ride when his turf is threatened by a younger, power-hungry up-and-comer. Crocodile Ganglands follows this river monster's struggle for power and survival as he deals not only with this test of his authority, but also with the increasingly harsh surroundings as drought hits the region hard.In this toughest of environments, few creatures and their offspring who dare to face the 'croc boss' escape with their lives. But, with a young contender looking to provide him with his biggest challenge yet, can the king croc hang on to his watery throne?

programme.title: Australia’s Deadliest Attacks
programme.desc: It’s no secret that the land Down Under is home to some of the most ferocious, venomous and just plain lethal creatures in the world, but the details can still be startling. Featuring real-life stories from people who have narrowly escaped death after encounters with Antipodean animals, Australia’s Deadliest Attacks combines eyewitness and survivor accounts with re-enactments and insight from animal experts. Whether it walks, crawls, swims or hops, even the unlikeliest animal could be one of Australia’s killers, and the survival tips featured in this series could save your life.Australia’s Deadliest Attacks starts on Thursday 28 March at 8PM.

But will a colony of thousands of bees ruin the holiday?Swamp Men: Croc SwapSafari director Ed Woods has a difficult - and dangerous - job on his hands as he looks to relocate a number of huge and potentially deadly Nile crocodiles to a new home.Swamp Men: Gator Breakout There's more croc commotion when Ed and his team realise that an alligator has escaped from 'Alcatraz', the fenced-in area that houses the nuisance gators that might have been destroyed elsewhere in Florida.Swamp Men: Fire Hazard The guys risk life and limb to search for injured animals while a forest fire ravages the nearby Seminole cultural area. With the hard work done, Ed organises a frog-leg eating contest to celebrate. But who will leap to victory?

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings
programme.desc: ‘Building fish mansions not fish bowls’ is their mantra and this sensational series shows why. Follow the best in the aquarium industry as they battle against piscatorial peril to create the most extreme fish tanks and fill them with exotic species from around the world.Taking on the most mammoth of missions, no job is too big for the Fish Tank Kings.

programme.title: Croc Caves of Africa
programme.desc: Katavi National Park in Tanzania: an isolated wilderness. Through the park flows the Katuma River: the lifeline for everything that swims, crawls, or walks. Follow the story of two mothers, a crocodile and a hippopotamus who share the same dangerous home, and see the perils of raising a family in this remote, beautiful location. Croc Caves of Africa premieres on Thursday 30 September at 10pm.

programme.title: When Crocs Ate Dinos
programme.desc: Some hundred million years ago, crocodiles were the ruling T-rexes of the waters. They galloped on land, ambushed prey at the river's edge... even terrorised dinosaurs. These swift predators' cousins evolved through the ages into the modern crocs we know today. Now, armed with newly discovered prehistoric crocodile bones, Explorer-in-Residence Dr. Paul Sereno is determined to bring the ancient creatures to life - and tell their fantastic untold story. Learn about a croc that pursued prey across land, a supercroc that locked its jaws around dinos, and even one with a startlingly canine face. Blending art, forensics and biology, Sereno's team recreates a lost world of strange Cretaceous crocs that paleontology forgot.

programme.title: Croc Caves of Africa
programme.desc: Katavi National Park in Tanzania: an isolated wilderness. Through the park flows the Katuma River: the lifeline for everything that swims, crawls, or walks. Follow the story of two mothers, a crocodile and a hippopotamus who share the same dangerous home, and see the perils of raising a family in this remote, beautiful location. Croc Caves of Africa premieres on Thursday 30 September at 10pm.

programme.title: Australia’s Deadliest Attacks
programme.desc: It’s no secret that the land Down Under is home to some of the most ferocious, venomous and just plain lethal creatures in the world, but the details can still be startling. Featuring real-life stories from people who have narrowly escaped death after encounters with Antipodean animals, Australia’s Deadliest Attacks combines eyewitness and survivor accounts with re-enactments and insight from animal experts. Whether it walks, crawls, swims or hops, even the unlikeliest animal could be one of Australia’s killers, and the survival tips featured in this series could save your life.Australia’s Deadliest Attacks starts on Thursday 28 March at 8PM.

programme.title: Dead Or Alive
programme.desc: Dead or Alive is a brand new series that explores what happens when wild animals and humans collide. Each episode features a different deadly predator – Bears, Cougars, Hippos, Elephants, Sharks and Alligators – attacking two different groups of people, resulting in one story of incredible survival, and one story of tragic and sudden death.

programme.title: World's Deadliest
programme.desc: World’s Deadliest looks at the most riveting moments of animal predation, breaking down the struggle for survival and supremacy into action-packed episodes. See how these deadly animals arm themselves, defend their position and ultimately take down all that choose to harm them. In this battle, size doesn’t always matter as the smallest animal can pack the deadliest blow.

programme.title: The Man Who Swims With Crocodiles
House Hunters International
programme.desc: Buying a house is difficult. Buying a house in a foreign country multiples the difficulty tenfold. International House Hunters follows adventurous couples who pack up their tape measure and passports and head off to start a new life in a new culture. Faced with three potential homes to choose from, how will the competing desires of location, convenience and good old-fashioned differences of opinion resolve themselves? From learning complex local regulations to finding suitable schools, the stresses come thick and fast, throw in the language barrier and things get even more tricky. So tune into International House Hunters and discover that, whether it's in New Zealand, South Africa or Singapore, the size of the second bedroom is a universal cause of anxiety. Claire, a quirky painter from Scotland is looking to simplify her difficult life and grow as an artist. Seeking artistic inspiration, she finds solace in the eccentric medieval town of Guardia Sanframondi, Italy. But will her tiny budget and huge dreams of success be enough to make her dreams come true in this sparsely populated village? Find out as House Hunters International shakes up the remote village of Guardia Sanframondi, Italy.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Henry Cole dusts off the leathers and heads to Scandinavia to attempt a 4,000km journey through Norway, Sweden and Finland. Experiencing some of the best mountain riding on the planet in Norway, Henry is in his element. That is until he gets to the famous Trollstigen switchback road, where a combination of campervans and coaches sparks a famous Henry rant. A trip to Hell to meet Miss Universe 1990 also seems to offer Henry mixed messages. Once on Sweden's beautiful roads though, calm is restored and Henry pushes on into Finland. Here he meets ex-rally driver Tommi Mäkinen and marvels at his incredible bike collection. Will torrential rain and fjord repetition boredom ruin Henry's trip or will the spectacular scenery win him over? You can be sure Henry will be the first to let you know. Henry Cole is off on his bike again this time riding some 4000 kms on a Scandinavian adventure through Norway, Sweden and Finland. Henry sets out from Oslo in search of the best mountain riding on the planet through the Fjords of Norway. He also checks out some of the finest hotels and attractions including base jumping in Lisaboten, the annual extreme sports festival in Voss and the world famous Landscape Hotel. Henry also explores Bergen and Balastrade and attempts to try some of the traditional cuisine, boiled sheep's head. But by the end of this first show Henry is way behind schedule and hasn't quite left Norway!

programme.title: Floyd Around the Med
programme.desc: The Moorish invasion of Spain from across the Straits of Gibraltar in 700 AD dramatically shaped the culture, the science, the astronomy, the gastronomy, the agriculture, religion and civilisation of Europe. In this stylish nine-part television series, Floyd embarks on a magical journey through the rich and varied cultures of the Mediterranean. He will witness the splendour of the architecture and discover the pride and passion that lies behind the history of the Med. Floyd will celebrate, as people always have, the great traditions of food and wine, the exotic fruits, vegetables and spices that have influenced cooking throughout the world. Keith Floyd begins his gastronomic journey of the Mediterranean in Greece as he cooks fish in lemon and dill sauce with saut

programme.title: Globe Trekker
programme.desc: It's great, it's glorious, it's Globe Trekker and it's back for a brand new series. Leading the way on this series of global adventures are Megan McCormick and Zay Harding. Megan tackles the sprawling metropolis of Los Angeles filled with both glitz and gangs before heading off to sample some Teutonic pleasures in Germany. Zay sets off for a tour of the Balkans before taking the temperature of Tel Aviv. With trips to Senegal, Honduras and Utah also on the itinerary we can, once more, get the insider information on some of the world's most exciting destinations. Buckle up your boots, it's time to go trekking. Traveller Megan McCormick spends a week in southern California, USA, exploring one of the world's most exciting and glamorous cities, Los Angeles. Like thousands of wannabe stars who over the years have flocked to L.A.'s most famous suburb Hollywood in the hope of finding fame and fortune in the movies, Megan starts her trip by signing on at the Central Casting agency with other hopefuls trying to land a part in a movie as an extra. After taking a tour around Paramount Studios, she heads to Beverly Hills to learn the tricks of the trade used by the paparazzi who follow the every move of the stars who frequent the area. Using the city's surprisingly good public transport system, Megan heads to downtown L.A., discovering the now faded glamour of Broadway's grand old movie palaces, before checking out the thriving historic Central Market amidst a newly revitalised city centre.

programme.title: Hotel Impossible
programme.desc: Competition in the hotel business is fierce. Online sites can kill a hotel's reputation with one bad review. If staff are untrained, surly or apathetic in a profession that lives or dies on service trouble will surely follow, and quickly. What can a struggling hotel operator do? Well the most sensible hire Anthony Melchiorri; one of the most sought after hotel "fixers" around. His no-nonsense approach can turn any establishment around in a matter of weeks and he plans to do just that in Hotel Impossible. Firstly, Anthony comes in undercover and secretly scouts the property, identifying its biggest problems. Then he meets with the staff, from entry-level to upper management, to determine the key operational issues. After coming up with a rescue plan and prescribing the changes that need to be made, Anthony looks to revamp the staff and transform the hotel. Not everyone takes Antony's plain speaking well but he's not here to listen to excuses. If you want to survive in this cut throat business be prepared to take some of Melchiorri's medicine. Anthony Melchiorri heads to the Hamptons where Gurney's Inn, a landmark oceanfront resort, is struggling to stay relevant. He overhauls the property's flat service and finds a solution to their management woes in a surprising place.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: In these three one hour shows Henry Cole sets off on his American chopper yet again to explore two more of America's breathtaking rides- this time though his bike is even more radical and brutal in deign- the Saxon Crown will not only stop onlookers in their tracks and set off car alarms with its deafening sound but it'll probably dole out serious discomfort to Henry as he rides in total over 3,500 miles aboard a monster that should only be ridden for a Sunday afternoon pose. Henry Cole embarks on one of America's most grueling rides on America's East coast riding some 2100 miles from Boston in the North East to Key West Florida, the most southern point in America following the legendary US 1.For this trip Henry has perhaps foolishly chosen one of the most radical custom choppers in production, a Saxon Crown, with no front mudguard, little suspension and a poor excuse for a seat - the world famous potholes of New York and the tropical rain of Florida will really test him to the limit! In this the first leg of his ride Henry reflects on the culture and history of Boston before heading off down US 1 into New York, a ride not for the faint hearted. After enjoying the frentism and vibe of New York Henry heads south through Philadelphia and Washington DC, before heading into the sublime riding offered up by North and South Carolina.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: In these three one hour shows Henry Cole sets off on his American chopper yet again to explore two more of America's breathtaking rides- this time though his bike is even more radical and brutal in deign- the Saxon Crown will not only stop onlookers in their tracks and set off car alarms with its deafening sound but it'll probably dole out serious discomfort to Henry as he rides in total over 3,500 miles aboard a monster that should only be ridden for a Sunday afternoon pose. programme.title: Floyd Uncorked
programme.desc: No. of Episodes: 8 In the first episode of this series about the wines of France Keith Floyd takes us to the classic wine region of Burgundy. Keith and Jonathan Pedley master of wine taste two of Burgundy's classic wines Chablis and Cote de Beaune. We discover how to taste wine properly and show you how to ensure that every time you buy a bottle of wine from now on you've a better chance of finding a winner. Keith cooks a Coq au Vin and Ham with White Wine and Mustard Sauce and he takes us on a tour of this famous region

programme.title: Great Scenic Railways-US & Canada
programme.desc: In this beautifully shot series, Great Scenic Railway Journeys ventures to North America and Canada giving fans of the Australia Special an opportunity to continue their journey. Some of the continent's most historic railroads are captured from the frozen tundra of Alaska to the high desert of Arizona, the White Mountains of New Hampshire to the Black Hills of South Dakota and through the prairies and mountains of Canada. There is also a fascinating insight into how a steam engine works and a look at the incredible amount of work required to keep them in operation, mostly done by enthusiastic volunteers. Millions of people each year are drawn to seek out and ride these magical trains and now you can ride along. Viewers are introduced to the rich history and legacy that the American Steam engine has had. Steamtown National Historic site is the first stop in our epic journey. Here we will find out how a steam engine really works! This location gives visitors a unique look at every aspect of steam railroading, from its conception, development, to the ongoing efforts to keep it alive today. Next we're off to the oldest operating Tourist railway in North America, the Black Hills, known world wide as the 1880 train, this journeys transports riders through the beautiful and unspoiled Black Hills of South Dakota. During our visit we will also visit their shop to see one of their locomotive restored and last stop takes viewers to the White Mountains of New Hampshire to climb on board the Conway Scenic Railway.

programme.title: Inside Luxury Travel-Varun Sharma
programme.desc: Proving that you can never have enough of a good thing, Varun Sharma returns to showcase yet more opulent living in Inside Luxury Travel. Fresh off the plane in Perth, Varun blows the jet-lag away as he takes a sailing trip with John Longley, a crew member from Australia's winning America's Cup team. Onto Munich and a tour of the oldest brewery in the region, Augustiner-Keller, alongside a tasting session, including an extremely rare grappa, shows what Varun particularly enjoys when in Bavaria. Putting his stein down momentarily, Varun visits Swarovski Crystal for a tour of their sparkling exhibits. For his very first show from a Mediterranean island, Varun explores Cyprus, taking an historic walk through the Pafos Archaeological site. Whilst in South Africa, Varun checks out Johannesburg before heading off on safari for a veritable animal viewing frenzy: ticking leopard, elephant, giraffe and hippos off his must-see list. With further visits to Marrakech, Costa Rica and Toronto also on the itinerary, let's hope Varun gets enough time to make the most of those five-star facilities. Varun Sharma starts his trip at the city of Perth in Western Australia. He then heads off to Rottnest Island where he takes a boat trip to see New Zealand fur seals and the lovely little Quokka, learns about Aboriginal Heritage at the King's Park, and sets off to Penguin Island. Later, Varun heads off on a Kangaroo Safari where he learns more about this marsupial. On the next day, he is on his way to Vasse Felix which is the oldest wine producer in the the region. Back to nature Varun takes a canoe trip on the River, visits a Eucalyptus Forest and sees the power of the ocean on part of the Cape-to-Cape walking trail.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Henry Cole completes his US adventures as he travels from Phoenix to Los Angeles on yet another monstrous chopper. Expect all the usual forthright opinions along the way as Henry journeys through the Joshua Tree National Park and other famous American landmarks. In the final programme in the series, Henry looks back at some of the highlights of his US adventures, introduces some unseen special moments and gives his tips and advice for anyone wishing to follow in his, very wide, tyre tracks. Bike mad presenter Henry Cole heads off yet again into the wilds of America. This time riding America

programme.title: Xtreme Waterparks
programme.desc: Hold onto your trunks as Xtreme Waterparks takes an adrenaline-fuelled ride on the wildest, over-the-top and exhilarating water rides in the world. From a high-speed, gravity defying slide in Orlando, Florida to the world's tallest water shoot in Rio De Janeiro, Brazil on which riders hit over 100 kph. Surely only the very brave or very foolish would tackle the world's only double looping water slide at Wave Water World in Austria or be tortured on a 40mph near-vertical drop on The Bomb Bay in Orlando. There's no end to the ingenious rides designed for only one thing, to make you scream! Take a ride down the world's fastest water slide, the Insano, a 65 mph slide in Brazil. In Vermont, try the world's largest, indoor, near-vertical looping slide and finally Edmonton's Center of Gravity, for the world's only indoor bungee jump into water - a terrifying leap of 10 stories.

programme.title: Xtreme Waterparks
programme.desc: When it comes to any kind of thrill ride, bigger is always better, right? Right! Well, there can be fewer bigger than Calypso waterpark in Ottawa in Canada. The park, famous for its sheer size, covers 100 acres and contains 35 slides, including the panic-inducing Summit Tower. The Summit is the tallest slide tower in North America with its peak standing at an incredible 171 feet; it's like jumping off a 17-story building. The Water Cube in China, renowned as the scene of many triumphs in the pool during the 2008 Olympics, has undergone a $25 million renovation and now is lit up by 37,000 sets of lights which offer a stunning spectacle in the Beijing skyline at night. With trips to Dubai, the Bahamas and Honolulu on the itinerary, there's plenty of other opportunities to get your fill of wet water thrills. Xtreme Waterparks is on the hunt for rides that thrill! First up is a visit to Caneva Waterpark and the slide that reigns as Italy's most terrifying. Then the Rocky Mountains to see what happens when you give four guys dish soap, a big ol' hill and a whole lotta plastic. After that we head to the notorious Jersey Shore to visit America's only ride in need of anti-venom. And finally, we're off to the base of the Alps to the ski town of Tignes to experience a headfirst drop like no other.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Henry Cole completes his US adventures as he travels from Phoenix to Los Angeles on yet another monstrous chopper. Bike mad presenter Henry Cole heads off yet again into the wilds of America. This time riding America

programme.title: Wildman's Off Limits
programme.desc: Don Wildman returns to prise open more closed doors as he delves into long forgotten secret hideaways and gains access to highly restricted areas. Firstly Don gets to explore some historic mega engineering under Manhattan as he looks at the astonishing tunnelling that was required to build Grand Central Station. On the other side of the US, Don attempts to replicate the mythical escape from Alcatraz prison in San Francisco. From one place allegedly impossible to get out of, Don gets to the see the inside of one building it's allegedly impossible to get into, the US Mint. Here Don gets to see how they make millions of coins every day. In Texas Don explores the Dallas Cowboys Stadium which boasts the largest dome of any stadium in the world and certainly requires a head for highs. So whether it's fighting wildfires in Florida or burning down the zMAX dragway in North Carolina in a dragster, Don is always looking to go Off Limits. From the Rockies to the Big Apple, Don Wildman is getting inside access into big engineering projects, world famous attractions and coolest factories in the country. He'll get his hands dirty and his feet wet making a million dollars' worth of gold, retracing the famous Escape from Alcatraz, making bourbon barrels in Kentucky, exploring mega engineering under Manhattan, and testing out a world record setting parade float just days before the big show.

programme.title: Globe Trekker
programme.desc: It's great, it's glorious, it's Globe Trekker and it's back for a brand new series. Leading the way on this series of global adventures are Megan McCormick and Zay Harding. Megan tackles the sprawling metropolis of Los Angeles filled with both glitz and gangs before heading off to sample some Teutonic pleasures in Germany. Zay sets off for a tour of the Balkans before taking the temperature of Tel Aviv. With trips to Senegal, Honduras and Utah also on the itinerary we can, once more, get the insider information on some of the world's most exciting destinations. Buckle up your boots, it's time to go trekking. Traveller Megan McCormick spends a week in southern California, USA, exploring one of the world's most exciting and glamorous cities, Los Angeles. Like thousands of wannabe stars who over the years have flocked to L.A.'s most famous suburb Hollywood in the hope of finding fame and fortune in the movies, Megan starts her trip by signing on at the Central Casting agency with other hopefuls trying to land a part in a movie as an extra. After taking a tour around Paramount Studios, she heads to Beverly Hills to learn the tricks of the trade used by the paparazzi who follow the every move of the stars who frequent the area. Using the city's surprisingly good public transport system, Megan heads to downtown L.A., discovering the now faded glamour of Broadway's grand old movie palaces, before checking out the thriving historic Central Market amidst a newly revitalised city centre.

programme.title: Departures
programme.desc: Returning from a once-in-a-lifetime trip around the world, Scott Wilson and Justin Lukach just can't settle back into their old pre-trip routine. So without pausing to unpack, our intrepid duo strike out again on another action-packed adventure. Never ones to stick to the well-worn path, this journey takes them from Antarctica to Zambia. Many dangerous animals lurk in the Amazon but getting attacked by vicious pink dolphins probably wasn't high on Scott and Justin's list of creatures to avoid. However, missing luggage and desert mayhem could have been anticipated in Mongolia. The chance to visit Antarctica is too rare to refuse and Scott and Justin marvel at this remote continent. New challenges, new experiences await but, once on the road, travelling becomes too much a central part of Scott and Justin's lives to stop. As always, to arrive you must first depart. Justin Lukach has been travelling alone for the past couple of months when Scott Wilson and Andre Dupuis decide to come meet him at a festival in Spain. They head to Gibraltar, where Justin is attacked by candy-stealing Apes, before hopping on a ferry and completely switching continents. Now in Morocco, they head inland towards F

programme.title: House Hunters International
programme.desc: House Hunters International offers a truly global guide to the property market, whether you fancy a flat in France or a mansion in Mexico. Take Allie and Cooper for example, they live for adventure. In the few short years this young couple has been together, they've been to 32 countries and Cooper's new job in Singapore makes it 33. Will they be able to find the dream home in the Lion City to convince them to put down some roots for a while? Jeff Coltharp, thanks to his father's job, also has the wanderlust has never been grounded to any place for longer than a couple of years. His new love Katya however, is keen to settle down and has her eye on Krakow, in Poland. However she also has her eye on the coveted Old Town district which might overstretch their budget. It seems the same stresses and strains as well as the same delights in looking for the ideal home occur the world over. After living in hot and dry Fresno, California for over ten years, Lisa Crews has reached her boiling point and now needs something different. Lisa thinks she's found the perfect spot to spend her hard earned money: Bocas Del Toro, Panama. She plans to rent the house out when she's back in California working, but her kids are looking towards immediate satisfaction.

programme.title: House Hunters International
programme.desc: Buying a house is difficult. Buying a house in a foreign country multiples the difficulty tenfold. International House Hunters follows adventurous couples who pack up their tape measure and passports and head off to start a new life in a new culture. Faced with three potential homes to choose from, how will the competing desires of location, convenience and good old-fashioned differences of opinion resolve themselves? From learning complex local regulations to finding suitable schools, the stresses come thick and fast, throw in the language barrier and things get even more tricky. So tune into International House Hunters and discover that, whether it's in New Zealand, South Africa or Singapore, the size of the second bedroom is a universal cause of anxiety. Claire, a quirky painter from Scotland is looking to simplify her difficult life and grow as an artist. Seeking artistic inspiration, she finds solace in the eccentric medieval town of Guardia Sanframondi, Italy. But will her tiny budget and huge dreams of success be enough to make her dreams come true in this sparsely populated village? Find out as House Hunters International shakes up the remote village of Guardia Sanframondi, Italy.

programme.title: Floyd On Italy
programme.desc: Keith Floyd's mission is to discover the varied tastes and the rich regional diversity of Italian cuisine. The eccentric chef abandons all conventions as he forays into the best restaurants and the most luscious vineyards of the land. Amidst the classic scenery Floyd prepares exquisite dishes including squid ink tagliatelle and Tuscan wild boar. Floyd starts his gastronomic tour of Italy with a sumptuous red mullet and pesto dish cooked in Liguria market place. He visits a Perono vineyard fishes for perch in Lake Maggiore and hunts for truffles in the hills of Piedmonte

programme.title: Ultimate Braai Master
programme.desc: Hosted by bush-cook guru, Justin Bonello, Ultimate Braai Master pits fifteen teams of two against each other in the search for the barbecue king of the grill. The teams will compete across a variety of gruelling outdoor cooking challenges throughout an extreme 52-day, 8,000km road trip. The winning team will collect a prize of half a million Rand, a brand new SUV and the title of South Africa's very first Ultimate Braai Master. As the food begins to sizzle so do the tempers, as each team has to quickly adapt to the rigours of sourcing their own ingredients and to the pressures of competition cooking. After each emotional and trying day, teams have to face the elimination challenge where the heat really begins to rise. Ultimate Braai Master proves that if you can't stand the heat of the barbie you should put down the tongs. Hosted by South African celebrity Bush-Cook, Justin Bonello, the Ultimate Braai Master represents South Africa's toughest outdoor kitchen. 15 teams of 2 competitors each compete across various grueling outdoor cooking challenges in an extreme 52-day, 8000km road trip. The game begins on the banks of the Orange River where the teams start their epic culinary journey across the length and breadth of South Africa. With a smorgasbord of hot challenges, teams realize they will have to work together to redefine the rules that govern cooking on an open fire.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: Beginning with some blackened snakehead, with barbecued muskrat to follow, all topped off with a serving of bone marrow ice cream can only mean one thing - you've foolishly chosen to dine with Andrew Zimmern. Scouring the country in search of more unique culinary experiences, Andrew finds there still plenty of weird and, for him at least, wonderful dishes his fellow Americans have been cooking up in their backyards. But it's not all elk heart tartar as Andrew meets people at the cutting edge of food technology such as a Zen butcher who aims to provide better meats, a cheese-maker who built his own cave to get it just right and university researchers trying to find out what makes cows produce the best milk. See if your appetite can survive another generous helping of Bizarre Foods America. There's a long line of tradition on the menu when Andrew Zimmern visits Baltimore and the Chesapeake Bay. From learning how to skin a muskrat from a local champion, to hauling in pots of fresh eels, to selling produce from a horse-drawn carriage, Andrew puts in some hard work to get a taste of this part of Maryland. Steamed blue crabs, fresh grilled eel, Korean blood sausage, and barbecued muskrat are just a few of the tasty treats Andrew gets to try!

programme.title: Airport 24/7 : Miami
programme.desc: Airport 24/7: Miami is an all access pass to the intense and dramatic world of Miami International Airport as seen through the eyes of those whose jobs it is to keep one of America's largest airports safe and operating around the clock. Miami Airport is considered a Category X airport, handling 38 million passengers a year and a key entry point to the US. As the airport is the size of a small city something is always happening; terrorist threats, fuel fires, smuggling rings, medical emergencies, sting operations, aircraft malfunctions and even car crashes outside the terminal. If you think you know life in an airport, think again. This is Miami Airport as you've never seen it before. Miami International Airport is a Category X Airport, which means it's at the highest risk for terrorist attack. When an incoming flight squawks a hijack code to the tower, it triggers a full-blown SWAT response. Meanwhile, Ericka handles a disgruntled passenger who claims she missed her flight and lost her bags. Then, all airside units respond to an emergency landing when an A330 aircraft reports hydraulic problems. The crisis creates a domino effect for both passengers and airport workers, which ripples into the next day when 600 passengers from two flights attempt to check-in simultaneously.

programme.title: Airport 24/7: Miami
programme.desc: Alongside the everyday tension and drama involved in operating one of the world's largest airports there are plenty of other unexpected issues to content with. Such as when Lamborghini chooses Miami Airport to unveil their new Aventador roadster resulting in the airport closing its longest runway and racing five roadsters in an attempt to break a ground speed record of over 200 MPH. Almost the next day, a bus crashes into an underpass and the MIA team faces one of the worst disasters in Miami Airport history. With drug busts and bomb threats seeming part of the everyday challenge in keeping this vast airport safe, no one can take their eyes off the action for a second. A bus crashes into an underpass and the MIA team faces one of the worst disasters in Miami Airport history. Customs agents uncover a massive drug shipment and reveal the undisclosed location where confiscated narcotics go.

A bus crashes into an underpass and the MIA team faces one of the worst disasters in Miami Airport history. programme.title: Xtreme Waterparks
programme.desc: When it comes to any kind of thrill ride, bigger is always better, right? Right! Well, there can be fewer bigger than Calypso waterpark in Ottawa in Canada. The park, famous for its sheer size, covers 100 acres and contains 35 slides, including the panic-inducing Summit Tower. The Summit is the tallest slide tower in North America with its peak standing at an incredible 171 feet; it's like jumping off a 17-story building. The Water Cube in China, renowned as the scene of many triumphs in the pool during the 2008 Olympics, has undergone a $25 million renovation and now is lit up by 37,000 sets of lights which offer a stunning spectacle in the Beijing skyline at night. With trips to Dubai, the Bahamas and Honolulu on the itinerary, there's plenty of other opportunities to get your fill of wet water thrills. Xtreme Waterparks is on the hunt for rides that thrill! First up is a visit to Caneva Waterpark and the slide that reigns as Italy's most terrifying. Then the Rocky Mountains to see what happens when you give four guys dish soap, a big ol' hill and a whole lotta plastic. After that we head to the notorious Jersey Shore to visit America's only ride in need of anti-venom. And finally, we're off to the base of the Alps to the ski town of Tignes to experience a headfirst drop like no other.

programme.title: Trip Flip
programme.desc: Bert Kreischer returns to surprise more unsuspecting couples with his offer a free trip-of-a-lifetime. For those brave enough to seize the moment, Bert pulls out all the stops, with OO7 jet-pack rides, shark-diving and a trips aboard the Thunder Boat just a few of the highlights on offer. Whether hanging out with the world-famous Bondi Beach life guards in Sydney, recording in Bob Marley's legendary studio in Jamaica or visiting the very top of the Seattle Space Needle, Bert's the man with the plan. Bert Kreischer brings two friends on an all-expenses paid trip to the windy city of Chicago, where they levitate like a jet-packed 007, roll like '30s gangsters, sail like pirates and shred invisible guitars like champions.

programme.title: Bert the Conqueror
programme.desc: Bert is back! After risking life and limb in his first outing, Bert Kreischer clearly hasn't learnt any lessons as he returns to take on more hilariously absurd but undeniably thrilling challenges. This time, Bert ups the ante with bigger, faster rides and bizarre local competitions you have to see to believe. Watch Bert's jowls furiously flapping with the g-force once more as he takes on Kingda Ka, the tallest, fastest rollercoaster on earth which goes from zero to 128mph in a world record-breaking 3.5 seconds. From El Toro, the tallest, fastest wooden roller coaster in America, to the North American Wife-Carrying Championship in Maine, nothing is off limits, for he is...Bert the Conqueror. Bert Kreischer visits Virginia for extreme thrills and competitions. At Busch Gardens in Williamsburg, Bert rides the Griffon, a monstrous coaster named after a mythical beast, before taking on the Intimidator 305 coaster at Kings Dominion in Doswell. Bert finishes his trip in Doswell, where he competes in the 16th annual Meadow Highland Games and Celtic Festival. Bert dons a kilt and enters this Scottish festival's stone throw competition, hammer toss, sheaf toss, and the signature event - the caber toss!

programme.title: Globe Trekker
programme.desc: It's great, it's glorious, it's Globe Trekker and it's back for a brand new series. Leading the way on this series of global adventures are Megan McCormick and Zay Harding. Megan tackles the sprawling metropolis of Los Angeles filled with both glitz and gangs before heading off to sample some Teutonic pleasures in Germany. Zay sets off for a tour of the Balkans before taking the temperature of Tel Aviv. With trips to Senegal, Honduras and Utah also on the itinerary we can, once more, get the insider information on some of the world's most exciting destinations. Buckle up your boots, it's time to go trekking. Traveller Megan McCormick spends a week in southern California, USA, exploring one of the world's most exciting and glamorous cities, Los Angeles. Like thousands of wannabe stars who over the years have flocked to L.A.'s most famous suburb Hollywood in the hope of finding fame and fortune in the movies, Megan starts her trip by signing on at the Central Casting agency with other hopefuls trying to land a part in a movie as an extra. After taking a tour around Paramount Studios, she heads to Beverly Hills to learn the tricks of the trade used by the paparazzi who follow the every move of the stars who frequent the area. Using the city's surprisingly good public transport system, Megan heads to downtown L.A., discovering the now faded glamour of Broadway's grand old movie palaces, before checking out the thriving historic Central Market amidst a newly revitalised city centre.

programme.title: Globe Trekker
programme.desc: Legendary travel show Globe Trekker returns to showcase more of the world's most spectacular destinations. Zay Harding heads to Antarctica for a once-in-a-lifetime trip, experiencing life in one of the world's harshest environments. Zay marvels at the wildlife in the region and considers seeing the 'penguin highway' as one of his greatest travel experiences. Meanwhile in sunny Barcelona, Megan McCormick takes the artistic route around this vibrant city and visits Gaudi's astonishing Sagrada Familia. Livewire Adele Ucar sets off for Nigeria and enjoys both the vibrant culture and the chaos of Lagos. With visits to Syria, Holland and Ukraine also on the itinerary Globe Trekker continues to offer an exciting and inspiring look at the world. Megan McCormick finds that even before the finest architects and urban planners came on board in an effort to 'turn Barcelona around' to face the sea, Antonio Gaudi shaped it more than any other and created an entirely original style - as a result you'll find his works scattered all over town. The city's major art galleries The Miro Foundation and Museu Picasso, celebrate similarly iconic artists and has no doubt also helped shape the colourful atmosphere of Las Ramblas. The team then heads to the bizarre antique shops, small bookstores and hip boutiques on offer in the Barr

programme.title: Ultimate Braai Master
programme.desc: Hosted by bush-cook guru, Justin Bonello, Ultimate Braai Master pits fifteen teams of two against each other in the search for the barbecue king of the grill. The teams will compete across a variety of gruelling outdoor cooking challenges throughout an extreme 52-day, 8,000km road trip. The winning team will collect a prize of half a million Rand, a brand new SUV and the title of South Africa's very first Ultimate Braai Master. As the food begins to sizzle so do the tempers, as each team has to quickly adapt to the rigours of sourcing their own ingredients and to the pressures of competition cooking. After each emotional and trying day, teams have to face the elimination challenge where the heat really begins to rise. Ultimate Braai Master proves that if you can't stand the heat of the barbie you should put down the tongs. Hosted by South African celebrity Bush-Cook, Justin Bonello, the Ultimate Braai Master represents South Africa's toughest outdoor kitchen. 15 teams of 2 competitors each compete across various grueling outdoor cooking challenges in an extreme 52-day, 8000km road trip. The game begins on the banks of the Orange River where the teams start their epic culinary journey across the length and breadth of South Africa. With a smorgasbord of hot challenges, teams realize they will have to work together to redefine the rules that govern cooking on an open fire.

programme.title: Hotel Impossible
programme.desc: Hotel owners everywhere beware, Anthony Melchiorri is back and running his expertly trained eye over some failing businesses. However, Anthony is also here to help by offering crucial advice in an attempt to salvage their livelihoods. First up is the Caribe Playa Beach Resort in Puerto Rico, which, despite its location a mere ten footsteps away from beautiful tropical beaches, hasn't turned a profit since 2006. One man actually pleased to see Anthony is Ashley Canty, owner of The Hotel Leger in California, who has invested over $800,000 into the sinking hotel. Whilst it seems the town has little use for this last remaining hotel, an appeal from Anthony to enlist the help of some concerned local citizens results in fifty people showing up. Jamaica has a reputation for laid back people but surely no one is as laid back as Gardenia Resort owner Carlyle who, despite the current occupancy rate being at a shockingly low 5%, actually believes that the hotel is being run well. Has Anthony finally met his match at this impossible hotel? Anthony Melchiorri heads to the island getaway Caribe Playa Beach Resort to reinvigorate a hotel that's a mere ten footsteps away from the beautiful tropical beaches of Puerto Rico. Owner George Engel struggles to make revenue off this prime real estate, which hasn't seen a profit since 2006.

programme.title: Hotel Impossible

programme.title: Luxury Train Journeys in India
programme.desc: Luke Kenny decides to take in some of the most famous sites in his beloved country of India. However, to avoid any possibility of an arduous journey, Luke takes a succession of luxury trains to smooth his passage. Beginning with a tour of Southern India aboard The Pride of the South, Luke travels through Karnataka and onto Goa. Next the Golden Chariot whisks him through Tamil Nadu and Kerala. Not tiring of the constant pampering, Luke bravely boards the Royal Rajasthan on Wheels for another punishing round of top class cuisine and soothing massages as the beautiful countryside and stupendous monuments of Rajasthan speed past. Throughout his travels Luke visits both the well known sites, such as the Taj Mahal, and the lesser known architectural wonders of India. For his last journey, Luke samples life aboard the Maharajas' Express, a relatively new luxury train operator and possibly the most exclusive yet. Will Luke have had his fill of luxuriousness at the end of his journey? Don't bet on it. Luke Kenny takes a ride aboard The Pride of the South, a luxury train that takes a fascinating railway journey to historical ruins in Southern India. The seven day voyage travels through the southern state of Karnataka visiting rich historical sites such as Hampi. Luke continues his journey ending up in Goa where he takes in the fantastic beaches.

programme.title: Luxury Train Journeys in India

programme.title: Great Scenic Railways-New Zealand
programme.desc: Great Scenic Railway Journeys travels to New Zealand to ride the rails. Like in most other countries, the railroads played a crucial part in the development of New Zealand. From the Rainforests of the North Island, to the beautiful coasts and rugged interior of the South Island, it was the railroad that opened the way. Award-winning musician and train aficionado David Holt hops on board to show how history was created and how it is now being preserved. Could this be the greatest scenic railway journey of them all? The journey starts in the Franklin District and the Glenbrook Vintage Railway located just outside of Auckland on the North Island for a true taste of what railroading was like in New Zealand a hundred years ago and to meet dozens of dedicated volunteers who restore carriages and steam engines for future generations to enjoy. The next stop is one of the most unique railroad journeys in the world, the Driving Creek Railway, founded Barry Brickell an artist, who originally moved to the hills of the North Island area in search of the right sort of clay for his craft. When he found it, however, he had to create a way to get it out of the hills and his railroad was born. A ride on Driving Creek will also give you a glimpse at some of the native plants Brickell vowed to bring back to this lush rainforest.

programme.title: Great Scenic Railways-New Zealand

programme.title: Descending
programme.desc: Descending to the depths of our oceans is where real adventure begins. No matter how tall the highest peak, how vast the broadest desert or how inhospitable the polar caps - it's all insignificant compared to what lies beneath the waves. Descending captures the thrilling adventures of Scott Wilson, Ellis Emmett and cinematographer Andre Dupuis as they journey into the depths of our world to see places and creatures few of us ever will. Nearly three quarters of our planet is water but the team set out to not just dive our oceans, lakes and rivers, but to discover the stories of human triumph and tragedy associated with the water, and assess with their own eyes the health of the unseen depths. Their own adventure becomes a mirror image of what they are searching for, with triumph and near tragedy always close at hand. An aquatic adventure series on an epic scale, Descending pushes the boundaries of underwater film-making to capture some of the most incredible underwater footage ever seen. Get ready to dive in. Seasoned travellers Scott Wilson and Andre Dupuis begin a new journey descending into the world beneath the waves. They travel to New Zealand to recruit friend and fellow explorer Ellis Emmett for the adventure. But equipment challenges and harsh weather impede the team's first dives.

programme.title: Insane Coaster Wars
programme.desc: Insane Coaster Wars is back and taking the world by storm! The quest is on to find the world's most terrifying rides full of death-defying drops, spine-torqueing twists and impossible inversions. From the world's fastest roller coaster in Abu Dhabi, to Europe's tallest wooden coaster, to the world's longest and tallest flying coaster in the US - no coaster is left unrolled. Strap in and get ready for a wild ride as Insane Coaster Wars: World Domination takes you around the globe to some of the most hair-raising, pulse-pounding thrill rides on the planet. The battle rolls into Germany for the tallest wooden coaster in the world and also an insane 90 mph coaster in Canada and a gut-wrenching 4g coaster in the United States - which coaster will crush the rest?

programme.title: Insane Coaster Wars
programme.desc: Take a heart-pumping adrenaline ride on the most insane, hair-raising roller coasters in the US and settle the battle once and for all - which coaster rules supreme? The coasters are all grouped by riding style and battle it out for the crown. From wooden splintering speedsters, that threaten to shake riders into a jabbering wreck, to modern speed demons, all trying to eliminate the competition with ever increasing mind-blowing speeds. With titles like G-Force Giants, Wrong Way Up and Extreme Heights, it's a thrill-seekers paradise. So buckle up tight for an all-access pass to ride the most spine-tingling, exhilarating, and intense coasters in the world. G-Force Giants terrify riders with each gravity-defying loop, roll, dive, and turn. Which coaster wins the battle of the G's - California's Medusa, the Carolinas' Afterburn, Virginia's Apollo's Chariot, or Tampa Bay's SheiKra? In the premiere episode of Insane Coasters Wars, four of America's top roller coasters packed with the most gut-wrenching G's will face off against each other.

programme.title: Bert the Conqueror
programme.desc: Bert is back! After risking life and limb in his first outing, Bert Kreischer clearly hasn't learnt any lessons as he returns to take on more hilariously absurd but undeniably thrilling challenges. This time, Bert ups the ante with bigger, faster rides and bizarre local competitions you have to see to believe. Watch Bert's jowls furiously flapping with the g-force once more as he takes on Kingda Ka, the tallest, fastest rollercoaster on earth which goes from zero to 128mph in a world record-breaking 3.5 seconds. From El Toro, the tallest, fastest wooden roller coaster in America, to the North American Wife-Carrying Championship in Maine, nothing is off limits, for he is...Bert the Conqueror. Bert Kreischer visits Virginia for extreme thrills and competitions. At Busch Gardens in Williamsburg, Bert rides the Griffon, a monstrous coaster named after a mythical beast, before taking on the Intimidator 305 coaster at Kings Dominion in Doswell. Bert finishes his trip in Doswell, where he competes in the 16th annual Meadow Highland Games and Celtic Festival. Bert dons a kilt and enters this Scottish festival's stone throw competition, hammer toss, sheaf toss, and the signature event - the caber toss!

programme.title: Bert the Conqueror
programme.desc: Just their names - 'Thunderhead', 'Big Shot', 'X-Scream', 'Intimidator', 'Afterburn', 'Master Blaster' - might give you an idea of what exactly it is that Bert is trying to conquer. The 'Bert' in question is Bert Kreischer, an everyday kind of guy who has decided to take on the most thrilling rollercoasters and the most hilariously absurd challenges America has to offer. Pitching himself up against the 'Fearsome Foursome Challenge' from the outset, Bert screams, shrieks and shouts his way through Cedar Point Amusement Parks' four fastest and tallest coasters in less than an hour. Head still spinning, Bert careers from Las Vegas to New Hampshire to Tennessee looking for the ultimate rollercoaster ride. Away from the thrill rides, Bert is also willing to take on any crazy challenge the locals can throw at him; from 'Blobbing' in Texas to 'Redneck waterskiing' in South Carolina. Bert turns no challenge down, nothing is off limits, for he is Bert the Conqueror! Bert Kreischer visits Sandusky, Ohio's Cedar Point Amusement Park to take on the "Fearsome Foursome Challenge": riding the park's four fastest and tallest coasters in less than an hour.

programme.title: Globe Trekker
programme.desc: It's great, it's glorious, it's Globe Trekker and it's back for a brand new series. Leading the way on this series of global adventures are Megan McCormick and Zay Harding. Megan tackles the sprawling metropolis of Los Angeles filled with both glitz and gangs before heading off to sample some Teutonic pleasures in Germany. Zay sets off for a tour of the Balkans before taking the temperature of Tel Aviv. With trips to Senegal, Honduras and Utah also on the itinerary we can, once more, get the insider information on some of the world's most exciting destinations. Buckle up your boots, it's time to go trekking. Traveller Megan McCormick spends a week in southern California, USA, exploring one of the world's most exciting and glamorous cities, Los Angeles. Like thousands of wannabe stars who over the years have flocked to L.A.'s most famous suburb Hollywood in the hope of finding fame and fortune in the movies, Megan starts her trip by signing on at the Central Casting agency with other hopefuls trying to land a part in a movie as an extra. After taking a tour around Paramount Studios, she heads to Beverly Hills to learn the tricks of the trade used by the paparazzi who follow the every move of the stars who frequent the area. Using the city's surprisingly good public transport system, Megan heads to downtown L.A., discovering the now faded glamour of Broadway's grand old movie palaces, before checking out the thriving historic Central Market amidst a newly revitalised city centre.

programme.title: Globe Trekker
programme.desc: Legendary travel show Globe Trekker returns to showcase more of the world's most spectacular destinations. Zay Harding heads to Antarctica for a once-in-a-lifetime trip, experiencing life in one of the world's harshest environments. Zay marvels at the wildlife in the region and considers seeing the 'penguin highway' as one of his greatest travel experiences. Meanwhile in sunny Barcelona, Megan McCormick takes the artistic route around this vibrant city and visits Gaudi's astonishing Sagrada Familia. Livewire Adele Ucar sets off for Nigeria and enjoys both the vibrant culture and the chaos of Lagos. With visits to Syria, Holland and Ukraine also on the itinerary Globe Trekker continues to offer an exciting and inspiring look at the world. Megan McCormick finds that even before the finest architects and urban planners came on board in an effort to 'turn Barcelona around' to face the sea, Antonio Gaudi shaped it more than any other and created an entirely original style - as a result you'll find his works scattered all over town. The city's major art galleries The Miro Foundation and Museu Picasso, celebrate similarly iconic artists and has no doubt also helped shape the colourful atmosphere of Las Ramblas. The team then heads to the bizarre antique shops, small bookstores and hip boutiques on offer in the Barr

programme.title: House Hunters International
programme.desc: Buying a house is difficult. Buying a house in a foreign country multiples the difficulty tenfold. International House Hunters follows adventurous couples who pack up their tape measure and passports and head off to start a new life in a new culture. Faced with three potential homes to choose from, how will the competing desires of location, convenience and good old-fashioned differences of opinion resolve themselves? From learning complex local regulations to finding suitable schools, the stresses come thick and fast, throw in the language barrier and things get even more tricky. So tune into International House Hunters and discover that, whether it's in New Zealand, South Africa or Singapore, the size of the second bedroom is a universal cause of anxiety. Claire, a quirky painter from Scotland is looking to simplify her difficult life and grow as an artist. Seeking artistic inspiration, she finds solace in the eccentric medieval town of Guardia Sanframondi, Italy. But will her tiny budget and huge dreams of success be enough to make her dreams come true in this sparsely populated village? Find out as House Hunters International shakes up the remote village of Guardia Sanframondi, Italy.

Find out as House Hunters International shakes up the remote village of Guardia Sanframondi, Italy.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Of all his adventures so far, Henry Cole is more sceptical than usual at the beginning of his ride through Russia that this will prove to be a world's greatest motorcycle ride. Starting in stunning St Petersburg, Henry is hugely impressed with the cultural splendour on offer. So far, so good. However, surprisingly soon after leaving the city Henry finds that the roads quickly run out of tarmac and he has to apply some motocross techniques to stay upright in the now persistent rain. Waking up in Cherepovetez, the third most polluted city in the world, doesn't really help matters. From here it's still another 1,500 miles to Moscow and along the route Henry is often confronted with virtually impassable roads. Even after arriving in Moscow Henry still has to tackle the gird locked road system in torrential rain. They say that out of great adversity great deeds come but it's heatnot entirely certain that Henry will see it that way. Resident motorcycle mad presenter Henry Cole is off on his travels again. The mission: To ride 2,500 miles across North West Russia from St Petersburg to journey's end in Moscow. Henry's voyage of discovery starts with a few days soaking up the luxury and cultural splendour of St Petersburg before he clambers aboard his BMW GS1200 to ride North east to towns that go by the names of Sortavala, Perdrozavodsk and Cherepovetez. Little does Henry know what he is letting himself in for as he leaves the security of St Petersburg behind. This ride will test every facet of his motorcycling skills and mental endurance!

programme.title: Floyd Around the Med
programme.desc: The Moorish invasion of Spain from across the Straits of Gibraltar in 700 AD dramatically shaped the culture, the science, the astronomy, the gastronomy, the agriculture, religion and civilisation of Europe. In this stylish nine-part television series, Floyd embarks on a magical journey through the rich and varied cultures of the Mediterranean. He will witness the splendour of the architecture and discover the pride and passion that lies behind the history of the Med. Floyd will celebrate, as people always have, the great traditions of food and wine, the exotic fruits, vegetables and spices that have influenced cooking throughout the world. Keith Floyd begins his gastronomic journey of the Mediterranean in Greece as he cooks fish in lemon and dill sauce with saut
